title: Deploying a contract hangs on contract.new() with latest develop.
body:
As already discussed with @karalabe this works fine with your latest release (1.3.4) but seems to fail on develop.

To reproduce:

```
git clone https://github.com/slockit/smart-contract
cd tests
geth --dev --genesis genesis_block.json --datadir ./data  console 2>> out.log.geth
> loadScript('deploy.js')
```

With 1.3.4 the script runs fine. But with latest develop it hangs waiting inside `contract.new()`. Any debug print statements placed inside the callback or after the `new()` function don't fire.

1. I looked at the code within `deploy.js` on getting and I honestly don't think you should be using `sleepBlocks` (on that notion we should probably remove it). Please use [bitchin'-tricks#mining](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/wiki/bitchin-tricks#mining). This however is not related to your particular problem but more a suggestion.
2. ~~could you provide an example which fails?~~ i'll try the example
@obscuren 2. He just did that :D :P
@obscuren Thanks for the trick, will use that. The problem I reported was that in develop the above just hangs at `contract.new()`
@LefterisJP did you unlock your account?
nm, i see it's in the script
@karalabe yes, i crossed it out
Seems fine to me https://www.dropbox.com/s/v5dmilcvy78wf20/Screenshot%202016-03-01%2011.46.56.png?dl=0
It does however fail with `> Error: The contract code couldn't be stored, please check your gas amount. undefined` but that's another problem I guess.
Oh, BTW I did remove the `sleepBlocks` method.
@obscuren Yes this is another problem I will work on now. But for me with latest develop it never gets there, only with the 1.3.4 release version.
@LefterisJP I'm on `develop`

```
7d598af49324176cd60b6ce89bc8a72080098675 2016-02-29 16:19:32 +0100

tree b3013f5e476d89f3fb92daff3455a5359e1cc161
parent 0d89e6c2f140a26fd615e9ebac08b17dd22a9616
author Jeffrey Wilcke <geffobscura@gmail.com> 1456759172 +0100
committer Jeffrey Wilcke <geffobscura@gmail.com> 1456759172 +0100

params: updated homestead block
```
I've merged in two PRs this morning which have been "imminent" for a week or so now, maaaybe something broke? Bas's contract creation was among them
Trying it out now

I pulled a few hours ago and am on:

```
Merge: f30b809 45d08a8
Author: Péter Szilágyi <peterke@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Mar 1 11:01:06 2016 +0200

    Merge pull request #2221 from karalabe/expost-key-decryption

    crypto: expose key decryption method to parse a string direclty
```
Still works on that commit.
Please make sure that 1. your account is unlocked prior to running that script and 2. you have that `sleepBlocks` removed.
Seems to hang on my machine too.
@obscuren I removed `sleepBlocks()` but it makes no difference since it's well after the point in the code where it hangs. The account unlocks in the very first line of the script.
Do you do this through console or attached geth?

In the very first post of the issue I wrote the steps I follow :)

```
git clone https://github.com/slockit/smart-contract
cd tests
geth --dev --genesis genesis_block.json --datadir ./data  console 2>> out.log.geth
> loadScript('deploy.js')
```

So essentially it's a geth with console.
@LefterisJP @karalabe could you try the `--testnet` and see if that makes a difference.
Trying linux in ~1h
Stacks during hang https://gist.github.com/fjl/48d4f2359e4a16a3e39a
Fixed :)
thanks guys, can confirm it as fixed
Cool, thanks for following up on it!
